Violation_Type: Failure to maintain permanent resident status
Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge correctly rejected the application based on loss of permanent resident status and being under a removal order
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.49(1)
Application_Facts: Applicant retained permanent resident status during ongoing appeal; however, was under a removal order
Decision_Outcome: Appeal dismissed; citizenship judge's decision upheld
Court_Ruling: Applicant ineligible for citizenship due to being under a removal order under para 5(1)(f)
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to meet residency obligations leading to removal order
Legal_Standard: Applicant must be a permanent resident and not under a removal order
Procedural_Issue: No delay allowed in citizenship proceedings under Citizenship Act s.14(1)
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation of eligibility criteria under Citizenship Act
Application_Basis: Ineligibility due to removal order despite ongoing permanent resident status
Evidence_Assessed: Existence and status of removal order
Governing_Rule: Citizenship applicants must not be under a removal order (para 5(1)(f))
Outcome: Application rejected; applicant may reapply if removal order appeal succeeds
Harm_Assessment: Denial of citizenship rights pending resolution of immigration status
Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to meet residency obligations led to a removal order, affecting eligibility for citizenship
Evidence_Handling: Consideration of removal order and appeal status as determinative factors
Legal_Provision_Violated: Citizenship Act para 5(1)(f) â€“ applying while under removal order
Evidence_Assessment: Removal order valid and in effect despite ongoing appeal
Decision_Rationale: Eligibility barred by removal order under para 5(1)(f), regardless of permanent resident status during appeal
Legal_Standard_Applied: Literal interpretation of statutory eligibility requirements under Citizenship Act
